title: Sky Profits Rise 10% After Strong Quarter
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Oct 21, 2015, 08:43 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 47 mins Sky Profits Rise 10% After Strong Quarter By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 1 hour 37 minutes ago View Photo 

The home entertainment and communications company which owns Sky News saw a strong start to its financial year with a 10% rise in quarterly operating profit. 
Sky plc (LSE: BSY.L - news ) , which has operations in five European markets including the UK, Germany, Ireland (Other OTC: IRLD - news ) and Italy, said on Wednesday that profit in the three months to the end of September rose by 10% to £375m, with revenue up by 6% to £2.8bn. 
The numbers represented Sky's strongest first-quarter growth for four years, and came despite intense competition for broadband and pay-television customers in its core UK market. 
The reporting period also included the first evidence of any impact of Sky's loss of live Champions League rights to rival BT Group (LSE: BT-A.L - news ) . 
Despite that, 43,000 new TV customers joined Sky, with broadband customer numbers up by 133,000. 
Importantly from the City's perspective, the level of customer churn - at 9.8% - was hailed by Sky as being at its lowest for more than a decade. 
The company said the performance reflected a strong focus on costs as well as the long-standing efforts to diversify its content and product offering. 
An acclaimed new crime drama, The Last Panther, starring the Bafta-winning actress Samantha Morton, will launch across all of the markets in which Sky operates. 
Sky's chief executive, Jeremy Darroch, said: "As we continue to place customers right at the heart of our business, we are focused on offering the very best content at the same time as anticipating customers¹ evolving needs, delivering the programmes that they love across multiple platforms and devices. 
"We want to make the viewing experience even better for all our customers. 
"Following the success of our proven connected home strategy in the UK and Ireland, we are beginning to roll this out across our other territories. 
"We now have almost 10 million connected households across the group, driving over 750 million views to our connected services this quarter alone. 
"As these results show, we are delivering against a clear set of plans across Europe, and are well positioned for the growth opportunities ahead."
